explains: n. 口径；才干；水准；器量（同 calibre）

sentences.en: It was no accident that many leading Roman soldiers and statesmen were writers of high caliber.
sentences.cn: 许多罗马的领军人物和政治家都是高水平的作家，这并非偶然。

sentences.en: The enemy was armed only with low caliber guns.
sentences.cn: 敌人只配备了短口径的枪。

sentences.en: But I worked my life to get to a place of this caliber.
sentences.cn: 但我一生辛劳以到达这种程度。
